verses.verse: Job<WH347> again<WH3254> took up his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559>
"Oh that<WH5414> I were as in the months<WH3391> of old,<WH6924> as in the days<WH3117> when God<WH433> watched over me;<WH8104>
when his lamp<WH5216> shone<WH1984> on my head,<WH7218> and by his light<WH216> I walked<WH3212> through darkness,<WH2822>
as I was in the ripeness<WH2779> of my days,<WH3117> when the friendship<WH5475> of God<WH433> was in my tent,<WH168>
when the Almighty<WH7706> was yet with me,<WH5288> and my children were around me,<WH5439>
when my steps<WH1978> were washed<WH7364> with butter,<WH2529> and the rock<WH6697> poured out<WH6694> streams<WH6388> of oil for me,<WH8081>
when I went forth<WH3318> to the city<WH7176> gate,<WH8179> when I prepared<WH3559> my seat<WH4186> in the street.<WH7339>
The young men<WH5288> saw<WH7200> me and hid<WH2244> themselves.<WH3453> The aged rose up<WH6965> and stood.<WH5975>
The princes<WH8269> refrained<WH6113> from talking,<WH4405> and laid<WH7760> their hand<WH3709> on their mouth.<WH6310>
The voice<WH2244> of the nobles<WH5057> was hushed,<WH6963> and their tongue<WH3956> stuck<WH1692> to the roof of their mouth.<WH2441>
For when the ear<WH241> heard<WH8085> me,<WH833> then it blessed me;<WH5869> and when the eye saw<WH7200> me,<WH5749> it commended me:
Because I delivered<WH4422> the poor<WH6041> who cried,<WH7768> and the fatherless<WH3490> also,<WH5826> who had none to help him,
the blessing<WH1293> of him who was ready to perish<WH6> came<WH935> on me,<WH490> and I caused the widow's heart<WH3820> to sing for joy.<WH7442>
I put<WH3847> on righteousness,<WH6664> and it clothed<WH3847> me.<WH4941> My justice was as a robe<WH4598> and a diadem.<WH6797>
I was eyes<WH5869> to the blind,<WH5787> and feet<WH7272> to the lame.<WH6455>
I was a father<WH1> to the needy.<WH34> The cause<WH7379> of him who I didn't<WH3045> know, I searched out.<WH2713>
I broke<WH7665> the jaws<WH4973> of the unrighteous,<WH5767> and plucked<WH7993> the prey<WH2964> out of his teeth.<WH8127>
Then I said,<WH559> <WH1478> 'I shall die in my own house,<WH7064> I shall number<WH7235> my days<WH3117> as the sand.<WH2344>
My root<WH8328> is spread out<WH6605> to the waters.<WH4325> The dew<WH2919> lies all night<WH3885> on my branch.<WH7105>
My glory<WH3519> is fresh<WH2319> in me.<WH5978> My bow<WH7198> is renewed<WH2498> in my hand.<WH3027>'
"Men listened to me,<WH3176> waited, and kept silence<WH1826> for<WH3926> my counsel.<WH6098>
After<WH310> my words<WH1697> they didn't<WH8138> speak again. My speech<WH4405> fell on them.<WH5197>
They waited<WH3176> for me as for the rain.<WH4306> Their mouths<WH6310> drank<WH6473> as with the spring rain.<WH4456>
I smiled<WH7832> on them when they had no confidence.<WH539> They didn't<WH5307> reject the light<WH216> of my face.<WH6440>
I chose<WH977> out their way,<WH1870> and sat<WH3427> as chief.<WH7218> I lived<WH7931> as a king<WH4428> in the army,<WH1416> as one who comforts<WH5162> the mourners.<WH57>
